etymology.description: semantic: 氵 (“water”) + phonetic: 去; simplified from earlier 灋, originally used to represent 廢 (“to cast aside; to abrogate”).
etymology.interpretation: Water hints at standards and regulation (leveling/flow) associated with law and methods, while 去 provides the sound cue for fǎ. The earlier complex form 灋 later standardized to the simpler 氵+去 structure now used for legal and methodological senses.

examples.chinese: 我们要依法行事(我們要依法行事)。
examples.english: We must act according to the law.

examples.chinese: 这条法律很重要(這條法律很重要)。
这种方法简单有效(這種方法簡單有效)。
examples.english: This method is simple and effective.
